Decision-making Test

Disclaimer: By answering the following questions, you are participating in a study examining decision-making strategies in learning tasks that is being performed by scientists at the University of California, Los Angeles. If you have questions about this research, please contact Andrew Forney at forns@cs.ucla.edu. Your participation in this research is voluntary. You may decline further participation, at any time, without adverse consequences. Your anonymity is assured; the researchers who have requested your participation will not receive any personal information about you.
 
Please only complete this HIT once. You will not be paid for retakes. If you have already completed this HIT or any other version of this HIT and submit it again, all submissions but the first will be rejected, and you will only be paid for the first submission. Having a submission rejected is detrimental to your reputation as a worker, and may prevent you from completing HITs in the future.

Decision-making Test - Instructions

In this study, you will be asked to answer 50 short questions of the following format:

  1. At the top of each page, you will be shown a word, which you should consider before clicking a button to reveal a selection of two additional words. The questions and answer choices are given in random order.

  2. One of the two options will be considered the "correct" choice by a hidden rule, and the other will be considered "incorrect."

  3. Your task: develop your own decision-making strategy to answer as many right as possible. You will receive a BONUS of $0.01 for each word that you choose correctly.

  4. You need not rush, but for each question, you will have 30 seconds to choose one of the answer choices. If you answer after the 30 seconds have elapsed, you will NOT receive a bonus $0.01 for answering that question correctly.

Please do this experiment in one sitting, without taking any breaks.

Reflection

Briefly describe your decision-making strategy while answering the previous questions.



Demographic Information

Lastly, please answer a few questions about yourself; you must complete all of the questions marked with an asterisk (*).

*What is your gender?

*How old are you?

*Which of these languages is your first language?

*What country are you from?



Thank You!
